intro: Rondeletia salicifolia subsp. brevicorolla, commonly known as the narrow corolla willow-leaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its willow-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The subspecies brevicorolla is distinguished by its shorter corolla compared to other subspecies of Rondeletia.
